intro: Ugni vaccinioides, commonly known as the Andean huckleberry, is a shrub native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, edible berries that are rich in antioxidants and are used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are evergreen and have a leathery texture, typical of plants in its family. Ugni vaccinioides thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
